AttributeDefinitions.network_code: Unique network name for the installation with a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.country: Country where the installation is located. Use ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 three-letter country code.
AttributeDefinitions.principle_investigator_name: Name of principal investigator (last name, first name) for the installation.
AttributeDefinitions.principle_investigator_address: Physical address and institution of principal investigator.
AttributeDefinitions.point_of_contact: Point of contact (last name, first name) for the metadata.
AttributeDefinitions.point_of_contact_email: Email address of point of contact.
AttributeDefinitions.point_of_contact_address: Physical address and institution of point of contact.
AttributeDefinitions.start_date: Start date of data collection at the installation in UTC.
AttributeDefinitions.end_date: End date of data collection at the installation in UTC. If installation is still in operation, use a future date (e.g. 2999-01-01).
AttributeDefinitions.funding_agency: Name(s) of agency that funded the experiment.
AttributeDefinitions.project_number: Funding project number. Should be supplied if a number has been assigned by funding agency(s).
AttributeDefinitions.digital_object_identifier: Digital Object Identifier that uniquely identifies the metadata, this identifier may only become available following archiving.
AttributeDefinitions.purpose_of_data_collection: Brief explanation of the purpose of the experiment.

AttributeDefinitions.interrogator_id: Unique identifier of the interrogator unit used in the experiment, assigned by data provider. Identifier should have a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.firmware_version: Firmware version of the software used within the interrogator.

AttributeDefinitions.acquisition_id: Unique identifier of the data acquisition, assigned by data provider. Identifier should have a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash). One identifier per acquisition settings.
AttributeDefinitions.interrogator_id: Unique identifier of the interrogator unit used in this data acquisition. The acquisition_id must nest within this interrogator_id.
AttributeDefinitions.acquisition_start_time: Start time of this data acquisition in UTC.
AttributeDefinitions.acquisition_end_time: End time of this data acquisition in UTC. if data acquisition is still in operation, use a date in the future (e.g. 2999-01-01T00:00:00.000Z).
AttributeDefinitions.acquisition_sample_rate: The rate at which the interrogator provides output data.
AttributeDefinitions.gauge_length: The length along the fiber between a pair of pulses, determined at experiment setup and used during acquisition.
AttributeDefinitions.unit_of_measure: Unit of measure of archived data set. This may be the same unit as the Interrogator Unit of Measure if the data are raw.
AttributeDefinitions.number_of_channels: The total number of sampling points along the fiber as output from the interrogator, referred to as NumberOfLoci in PRODML.
AttributeDefinitions.spatial_sampling_interval: The channel spacing, or offset, between channels.
AttributeDefinitions.pulse_rate: Rate at which the interrogator unit interrogates the fiber sensor.
AttributeDefinitions.pulse_width: Width of the pulse sent down the fiber in unit of time.

AttributeDefinitions.channel_group_id: Unique identifier of the channel group. Identifier should have a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.interrogator_id: Unique identifier of interrogator used corresponding to this channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.acquisition_id: Unique identifier of interrogator used corresponding to this channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.cable_id: Unique identifier of cable linked to this channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_id: Unique identifier of fiber linked to this channel group. The fiber_id must nest within specified cable_id.
AttributeDefinitions.coordinate_generation_date: Date that the channel coordinates were generated.
AttributeDefinitions.coordinate_system: Coordinate system used in channel location. Select geographic for coordinates in latitude and longitude. UTM is the preferred projected coordinate system.
AttributeDefinitions.reference_frame: Geodetic datum and / or grid zone number in UTM.
AttributeDefinitions.location_method: Method used to determine the coordinates of each channel. Example: tap test, GPS tracker.
AttributeDefinitions.x_coordinate_unit: Unit of x-coordinate (UTM-x or longitude). Applies to every individual channel nested under the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.uncertainty_in_x_coordinate: Uncertainty in the x-coordinate (UTM-x or longitude), representing the average uncertainty for all the channels.
AttributeDefinitions.y_coordinate_unit: Unit of y-coordinate (UTM-y or latitude). Applies to every individual channel nested under the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.uncertainty_in_y_coordinate: Uncertainty in the y-coordinate, representing the average uncertainty for all the channels.
AttributeDefinitions.elevation_above_sea_level_unit: Unit of elevation above sea level. Applies to every individual channel nested under the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.uncertainty_in_elevation: Uncertainty in elevation above sea level, representing the average uncertainty in elevation for all the coordinates.
AttributeDefinitions.depth_below_surface_unit: Unit of depth below surface. Applies to every individual channel nested under the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.uncertainty_in_depth: Uncertainty in depth below surface, representing the average uncertainty in depth for all the coordinates.
AttributeDefinitions.strike_unit: Unit of strike. Defined at the channel group level as it applies to every individual channel nested under the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.uncertainty_in_strike: Uncertainty in the strike in meters.
AttributeDefinitions.dip_unit: Unit of dip. Defined at the channel group level as it applies to every individual channel nested under the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.uncertainty_in_dip: Uncertainty in the dip in meters.
AttributeDefinitions.first_usable_channel_id: The first channel considered physically meaningful. Typically, this will be a few channels after the last channel inside the interrogator. Must match one of the channel ids.
AttributeDefinitions.last_usable_channel_id: The last channel considered physically meaningful. Typically, an acquisition will add virtual channels at the end of the fiber or the optical path might not reach the end of the fiber and this can be used to cut the dataset into a working set. Must match one of the channel ids.

AttributeDefinitions.channel_id: Unique identifier of the individual channel, with a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.channel_group_id: Unique identifier of the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.distance_along_fiber: Distance along fiber between the interrogator and channel. Zero meter at the connector to the interrogator; negative distances for fiber section inside the interrogator.
AttributeDefinitions.x_coordinate: x-coordinate (UTM-x or longitude) of the channel.
AttributeDefinitions.y_coordinate: y-coordinate (UTM-y or latitude) of the channel.
AttributeDefinitions.elevation_above_sea_level: Elevation or height above sea level.

AttributeDefinitions.channel_id: Unique identifier of the individual channel, with a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.channel_group_id: Unique identifier of the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.distance_along_fiber: Distance along fiber between the interrogator and channel. Zero meter at the connector to the interrogator; negative distances for fiber section inside the interrogator.
AttributeDefinitions.x_coordinate: x-coordinate (UTM-x or longitude) of the channel.
AttributeDefinitions.y_coordinate: y-coordinate (UTM-y or latitude) of the channel.
AttributeDefinitions.elevation_above_sea_level: Elevation or height above sea level.

AttributeDefinitions.channel_id: Unique identifier of the individual channel, with a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.channel_group_id: Unique identifier of the channel group.
AttributeDefinitions.distance_along_fiber: Distance along fiber between the interrogator and channel. Zero meter at the connector to the interrogator; negative distances for fiber section inside the interrogator.
AttributeDefinitions.x_coordinate: x-coordinate (UTM-x or longitude) of the channel.
AttributeDefinitions.y_coordinate: y-coordinate (UTM-y or latitude) of the channel.
AttributeDefinitions.elevation_above_sea_level: Elevation or height above sea level.

AttributeDefinitions.cable_id: Unique identifier for the specific physical cable used in the data acquisition. Identifier should have a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.cable_bounding_box: List of approximate coordinates of the bounding box containing the array [minimum latitude, maximum latitude, minimum longitude, maximum longitude].
AttributeDefinitions.cable_installation_date: Cable installation date in UTC. This may not be known, an optional field.
AttributeDefinitions.cable_removal_date: Cable removal date in UTC. This may not be known, an optional field.
AttributeDefinitions.cable_characteristics: Describes how the fiber is encased in the cable.
AttributeDefinitions.cable_environment: Describes the installation environment of cable.
AttributeDefinitions.cable_installation_environment: Plain language description of how the cable was installed.
AttributeDefinitions.cable_outside_diameter_unit: Unit of outside diameter of cable.

AttributeDefinitions.fiber_id: Unique identifier for the physical fiber, with a maximum of 8 alphanumeric characters with no special characters (e.g., underscores, period, dash).
AttributeDefinitions.cable_id: Unique identifier associates this fiber to a specific cable.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_refraction_index: Refractive index of the fiber (unitless). Typical value for single mode fiber is 1.4681.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_winding_angle: If helical, this is the winding angle relative to the center of the cable.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_start_location: The start distance along the fiber with respect to the interrogator, referred to as StartLocus in PRODML.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_end_location: The end location or distance along the fiber with respect to the interrogator.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_optical_length: Total length of this fiber. Typically, it is the sum of fiber_start_location and fiber_end_location.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_one_way_attenuation: Power loss for one-way travel of a beam of light. Typical value for single mode fiber is 0.4 db/km.
AttributeDefinitions.fiber_one_way_attenuation_unit: Unit of fiber one way attenuation.
